DataElement.preferredName: Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function-Adult Version Task Monitor Scale T-Score Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric representation of the T-score for the Task Monitor Scale in the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function-Adult Version.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function, Adult Version Task Monitor Scale T-Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standardized measure that assesses the executive functions of adults aged 18-90 years in their everyday environment. Both a self-report and an informant report are used._A rating scale included in the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function-Adult Version that reflects the ability to keep track of one's problem-solving success or failure, and to identify and correct mistakes during behaviors._A method for converting an individual score into a standard form. While similar to a z-score, t-score is used when the conversion is made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function, Adult Version
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A standardized measure that assesses the executive functions of adults aged 18-90 years in their everyday environment. Both a self-report and an informant report are used.

Concepts.longName: Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function, Adult Version
Concepts.definition: A standardized measure that assesses the executive functions of adults aged 18-90 years in their everyday environment. Both a self-report and an informant report are used.

Property.preferredDefinition: A rating scale included in the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function-Adult Version that reflects the ability to keep track of one's problem-solving success or failure, and to identify and correct mistakes during behaviors.:A method for converting an individual score into a standard form. While similar to a z-score, t-score is used when the conversion is made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean.

Concepts.definition: A rating scale included in the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function (BRIEF) that reflects the ability to keep track of one's problem-solving success or failure, and to identify and correct mistakes during performance of a goal.

A method for converting an individual score into a standard form. While similar to a z-score, t-score is used when the conversion is made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: BRIEF-A:Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function-Adult Version. Robert M. Roth, PhD, Peter K. Isquith, PhD, Gerard A. Gioia, PhD, Psychological Assessment Resources, Lutz, FL, 2005
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for COG study in Rave per request by W.Wong. mc 4/2/15

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity that represents the conversion of an individual score into a standard form made without knowledge of the population standard deviation and mean for the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.origin: BRIEF-SR: Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function-Self-Report Version. Steven C. Guy, PhD, Peter K. Isquith, PhD, Gerard A. Gioia, PhD, Psychological Assessment Resources, 2004
ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created for COG study in Rave per request by W.Wong. mc 3/25/15
